text: Italian-Style Stuffed Banana Peppers Combine the sausage, bread crumbs, Romano cheese, and egg together in a large mixing bowl. Mix the ingredients well, and add salt and pepper to taste. Arrange the banana peppers on a cutting board. Use a chef's knife to cut the stem off of each pepper, and scoop out the seeds. Spoon the the sausage mixture into each pepper. Place the stem back on top of each pepper if desired; otherwise, discard the stems. Heat vegetable oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Place the stuffed peppers into the pan and cook each side for 2-3 minutes, or until browned. Place the marinara sauce in a serving dish. Arrange the stuffed peppers on top of the sauce, and add grated ricotta cheese. Serve warm. Bacon-wrapped Stuffed Peppers Arrange the peppers on a cutting board. Using a sharp knife, cut a vertical slit into each pepper from the stem to the bottom. The slit is used as an opening for the stuffing; do not cut all the way through to the other side. Combine the cheese, tomato, onion, bell pepper, and jalapeño peppers in a mixing bowl. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Spoon the mixture evenly into each banana pepper. Wrap one or two pieces of bacon (depending on your personal preference) around each banana pepper and secure each one with a toothpick. Place the stuffed peppers on the tray of a broiler pan. Broil for 5 minutes on each side, or until golden brown. Serve warm and enjoy!
